fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62385].
  {panel}

It would be very useful to have a quick jump list which allows the user to search and navigate directly to a project or board.

I would envision it functioning as follows:

# User presses `_q_` (or another appropriate shortcut)
# A searchable list much like the quick operations list appears allowing the user to filter to a board or project by typing it's name or a portion thereof.
# Pressing Enter or clicking on the item will jump the user to the board or project as appropriate.

An alternative way to access this would be via the project or board drop down menus, this would then allow the user to specifically search for boards or projects.
fields.summary: UI: Provide a quick project and board search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62383].
  {panel}

In our pretty large organization, more and more teams use sprints and usually have their naming convention.

To setup the board, we mostly rely on components, but sometimes multiple components are used and, then the issue can be added in another team's sprint.
 This can "pollute" the team dashboard by showing other teams' sprints, sometimes also pollutes dashboards showing current sprint burndown, because their sprint comes first in priority.

The way I found so far is to exclude some components, but it's not an ideal solution, since those issues then completely disappear from the board, while not being worked on yet.

Similarly to components, where we have {{component in (componentsWithString(...))}}, I'd like to be able to filter the sprints by a given pattern, so that the query would look like this:
 {{project = ABC AND component = XYZ AND (Sprint is EMPTY or Sprint in (sprintsWithString("MySprintPattern - "))}}
* with pre-condition that all my sprints contain {{MySprintPattern - }} pattern, for instance \{\{MySprintPattern - 01}}, {{MySprintPattern - 02}}, etc.
* this basically means, once the issue of my component is assigned to another teams' sprint, then only the issue would disappear from my board
fields.summary: Add "sprintsWithString" JQL function to be able to filter sprints by their name

fields.description:
*+Issue Summary+*

When a user gets the latest JIRA Cloud backup from their Cloud instance and migrate this on to their JIRA Server instance that is connected to an Oracle database, they get the error seen below:

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

*+Steps to Reproduce+*
 # Install JIRA 7.1.9
 # Connect the JIRA instance to an Oracle database.
 # Get a JIRA Cloud backup.
 # Restore the cloud backup on to the JIRA instance from {{Admin > System > Restore system}}
 ** During restoration, there has been 2 observed behaviors:
 --- JIRA fails at about 90% and on *restarting* the instance you see the above error.
 --- JIRA completes the import and shows you the login screen but should you *restart* JIRA for any reason, you would see the above error.

(i) _Error occurs even if you restore to postgres first and then migrate the backup to oracle from the JIRA UI_

*+Workaround+*

The instance seems to be restricted to Oracle as I have tested this on H2 and Postgres and the issue could not be replicated.
fields.summary: Restoring Latest Cloud Backup on JIRA Server Using Oracle breaks JIRA

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Enable/install *JIRA Service Desk* or *JIRA Suite Utilities* add-on;
 # Perform a re-index;
 # Restart JIRA;

h4. Expected result

JIRA wouldn't prompt for a re-index.
h4. Actual result

It will prompt for a re-index due to changes on "Plugins" section.
h4. Workaround
 * Proceeding with a re-index will get rid of the message, but just until JIRA is restarted again.

*Notes:*

fields.summary: JIRA restart triggers re-index message

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to print the Issue page using right-click > Print option, the preview it's cutting off other pages when we have more than 1 to show. This will not only affect the preview but will also cut the pages in the printed issue itself.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select an Issue
 # Right-click on the page
 # Select option "Print"

h3. Expected Results

The print preview display all pages available
h3. Actual Results

The print preview is not showing all pages available as shown below
 !print_preview.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

JIRA version 7.1.9 is not affected
h3. Workaround

There are workarounds:
# Use Printable option at Export button instead of using the right-click option (be advised that images are not included in this version).
# Append {{?filter=-1}} to the URL removes the sidebar and allow printing all the pages.
#- Please make sure that Issue Navigator is configured as *List View* before trying this workaround. If it is configured as *Detailed View*, you will redirect to Issue Navigator when accessing the issue page.
# You can add this Javascript on the [Announcement Banner|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/configuring-an-announcement-banner-829826989.html]. Full credit for this workaround goes to [~zcapalbo]:
{noformat}
<style type="text/css">
@media print {
.issue-view

{ overflow-y: visible !important; }
}
</style>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Print option in the browser will not print all pages of an issue if there is more than one page to print

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62371].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When viewing the sub-task type in its parent issue view screen, you are only able to differentiate by its icons, and not the issue type name.

h3. Suggested Solution
To be able to display the Sub-task Issue Type Name as well beside the icon. 

h3. Workaround 
# Create a new Custom Field(Issue Type) for your sub-tasks. Obtain the ID for this custom field.
# Follow the [guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/how-to-display-custom-field-of-the-sub-task-in-the-parent-issue-screen-163939652.html] however the order for below step is changed.(Where xxxxx the the id of your custom field.)
|customfield_xxxxx, issuetype, status, assignee, progress| 
# Once you have done the above, you would be able see that this custom field will appear in the order before the icon.
# You will need to make a copy of the existing workflow(if the workflow is shared by other different projects) to make it unique for sub-tasks only. You will also need the plugin [Suite Utilities for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.googlecode.jira-suite-utilities/cloud/overview].
# In the new workflow, locate the transition from *Create Issue* to *Open*. In this transition, add a new post-function *'Copy Field value from other Field'*.
!screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
# For Source Field, select *Issue Type* while for Destination Field, select the *Custom Field* that you have created for the sub task. For option, choose 'Copy withing same issue' and add the post-function.
# Once all the above is done, each time you create a sub-task, the post function will copy the value of the Issue Type Name and copy it into the new custom Field which will now then appear in your sub task list in its parents issue view screen.
fields.summary: Display Issue Subtask Type Name in Parent Issue View Screen.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62369].

Hi 

I am using JIRA Server 7.2. 

In one of my projects, that has public access for browsing, I have set an Issue security scheme consist of 2 security levels: 1) "Team members Only" and 2) "Guests". for each issue in this project, security level is set. I guess my configurations are ok.

My problem is that guests (users without a JIRA account) can not view those issues with security level "Guests". 

** Guest security level: Group (Anyone) . it should be right. ha?

How can I fix that?

*** one more question: How can I alter the filters in my project board to show to guests?

 

-Afrooz
fields.summary: Public and Private issues in 1 project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62368].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, users can be given group memberships through nested groups. This may make it hard to track exactly how/why certain users are given permissions to certain projects/etc. 

This is even more critical when the permission in question is permission to access JIRA. If nested groups causes the user count to exceed the license, JIRA will not be usable

h3. Suggestion
Make nested group memberships easier to be identified, especially if they affect the entire instance (eg. application access, etc)
fields.summary: Make Nested Groups memberships easily identifiable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62367].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When using a Select List (cascading) type field with a high number of options, it takes couple of seconds for all these options to be loaded for the dropdown menu, causing a delay when opening the Create window.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Add a auto-complete renderer for fields of the Select List (cascading) type to avoid all options from being loaded when creating a new issue. This will also help users when looking for specific values, as they won't need to scroll through a high number of options to find the desired value.
fields.summary: Select List (cascading) Auto-Complete

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62366].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Export to Excel CSV is not displaying full name of users in file.

h3. Environment

* JIRA Version 1000.285.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into JIA Cloud instance
# Issues > Search for issues
# Make sure either Assignee or Reporter is field is being displayed
# Export Icon (Top right) > Export Excel CSV (all fields or current field)

h3. Expected Results

* For the CSV to export a file with user Full Name

h3. Actual Results

* CSV file exported contains username instead of full names

h3.Workaround

* As a workaroud you can use the Export HTML Report (current field/all fields). You can then edit the name of the file from <filename>.html to <filename>.xls and it should open up in your spreadsheet program. You may run into this bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-61891
fields.summary: Export to Excel CSV is displaying username instead of full names

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62365].
  {panel}

It would be quite helpful if we could have additional configuration options for filters and their subscriptions.

Some examples of such confirguration options might be:
* Description/Notes -- Customizable note/description for the administrator to populate which could include links to Confluence KB
* From Name -- From email can remain the same, but possibly have a different name
* Email Header: Importance -- High/Default/Low -- https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4021#page-32
* HTML Background (eg. change background color based on the filter)

The reason is when a large number of them are open, additional options to help differentiate one from another is extremely helpful. 

For subscriptions, I know I can do so at the rule level within my mail client, but that doesn't help the remaining members of the team when they received dozens of subscriptions.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Provide more customization for filters & subscriptions such as notes, 'from, importance, etc.

h3. Description.

Currently, in JRA, all the story can be added into a sprint without any restriction. The user would like to create a condition to restrict only certain story can be added to the sprint.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. PROBLEM:

Currently, Atlassian applications are using a variety of recommended database collation when using MSSQL server.
 # Confluence - SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS
 # BitBucket - SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS
 # FishEye - Latin1_General_CS_AS
 #  JIRA - SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI or Latin1_General_CI_AI

 
h3. h3. SUGGESTION:

To have a standardized/uniformed database collation for all Atlassian applications when using SQL server.
fields.summary: Standardized the Recommended MS SQL Collation for all Atlassian applications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62359].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

JiraUserAvatarProvider.getAvatar(final String email, final int size) called userManager.getUsers() so that it could iterate through all of them to find a matching email address.

This is very slow and calling this from a search will bring JIRA performance down significantly as seen in JDog recently.h3. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce.

1. Call JiraUserAvatarProvider.getAvatar(final String email, final int size)
2. Observe the behaviour described in the summary.
fields.summary: JiraUserAvatarProvider queries all users to find a matching email address

  {panel}

It would be great if the error being thrown in the JIRA UI will be more specific rather than giving a generic error message. Perhaps, giving hints on why something is not working. 

 

As an example, on the issue navigators's advanced search,

!filter.png|thumbnail!
"A value with ID 'xxxxx' does not exist for the field 'project'."

In this case, user running the JQL doesn't have a permission on the project. It would be better if the error will be something like:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62351].
{panel}
h3. Summary

If a transition (using generic event) is not configured to send email, however, a user adds a comment on the transition screen (IssueCommented event configured to send email), then the IssueCommented event does not send an email as well. JIRA doesn't generate IssueCommented event, so the user does not receive an email for this comment.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a workflow transition with post function to fire Generic event.
 # Make sure to edit notification scheme so that Generic event does not send email
 # Make sure to edit notification scheme so that IssueCommented event sends email
 # Create an issue
 # Transition the issue and add a comment on the transition screen

h3. Expected Results

Use should receive an email for the IssueCommented event
h3. Actual Results

No email is received for this comment.

There is nothing written in the atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log
h3. Notes

As a user, a comment added during a transition or on the view issues screen directly, is the same. They appear the same way on the issue. So, they should be treated the same way too.
h3. Workaround

- Use a 3rd party add-on such as Automation for JIRA or JIRA Enterprise Mail Handler.
- For JIRA Service Desk, built in Automation can be used
fields.summary: Adding a comment in a transition screen does not trigger the IssueCommented event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62346].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Currently, the issue collector delivers a fragment of HTML/JS to embed in the client website that interacts with JIRA via a URL that encodes state in it. 

Following on, the client browser will cache the content and a (potentially) outdated resource will be used by the client browser when JIRA or its plugins are upgraded. 

This is worsened by the fact that products such as Confluence, Portfolio and Stash are hardcoding these URLs (currently pointing to JAC) in the actual source of these products and are basically using these URLs as "API" :(

h3. Steps to Reproduce.

1. Create an issue collector in JIRA.
2. Get the html fragment for the issue collector and embed it into a html page.
3. Visit the the html page and use the collector so that the browser caches the content.
4. Make a change to JIRA source such that the content delivered for the URL included in the html fragment provided by the collector is different.
5. Restart JIRA.
6. Visit the external html page and try to use the collector again.

h3. Actual Results
* The content retrieved from the URL by the embedded collector is out of date and does not reflect the changes done in step 4.

h3. Expected Results
* The content retrieved from the URL by the embedded collector is up to date and reflects the changes done in step 4.

h3. Workaround

Clear the browser cache to obtain the new content.
fields.summary: Issue collector URLs should deliver the most recent JS/HTML for the version of JIRA hosting the collector
Increase the size of the Status "label" displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71606].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently REST API for [edit issue|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.1.9/#api/2/issue-editIssue] and similar requires _field_id_  as a parameter. 
Eg:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -v -upass:pass -X PUT -H 'Content-Type:application/json' -d '{"fields": { "customfield_11000": "1" } }' http://127.0.0.1:8080/rest/api/2/issue/PRG-11

< HTTP/1.1 204 No Content
{code}
And using CustomField _name_ doesn't work:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -v -upass:pass -X PUT -H 'Content-Type:application/json' -d '{"fields": { "readonly-fields": "1" } }' http://127.0.0.1:8080/rest/api/2/issue/PRG-11

< HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"readonly-fields":"Field 'readonly-fields' cannot be set. It is not on the appropriate screen, or unknown."}}
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow using CustomField _name_ as a parameter for REST API calls. 
This will allow the sharing of any REST API call across any platform as soon as same CustomField  exist into these platforms.
 
h3. Workaround 
Use REST API call to get the mapping
* api/2/issue/<issueIdOrKey>/editmeta 
** https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/latest/issue/JRA-62343/editmeta
* rest/api/2/field
** https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/field
fields.summary: REST API: Allow to use name of Custom Fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62342].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When using the 'Advanced' JQL search, the 'was' function appears to support very little in terms of predicates. This is a extremely powerful operator to use for finding issues that were in a single or multiple status. It would be great if we could extend the functionality of this within JQL to accept other fields.

h3. Environment
Server - Current
Cloud - Current

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Goto Issue Navigator
# Switch to the Advanced JQL search
# Type in JQL using the 'was' operator

Example: Sprint was "This is a sprint"

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should return results based on this filter

h3. Actual Results
JIRA indicates the JQL is valid (because it is) however, JIRA then displays an error:

{noformat}
History searches do not support the 'Sprint' field.
{noformat}

h3. Summary
When you disabled keyboard shortcuts in your user profile and perform certain actions, then keyboard shortcuts would work although disabled. Most keyboard shortcuts are relatively harmless because they prompt before doing anything. However, some just go off and do stuff without prompting, eg. 'i' for Assign to Me. This makes them dangerous.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Disable keyboard shortcuts in your profile.
# Open a ticket or hard-refresh the browser page if it's already open.
# Type a keyboard shortcut and verify it doesn't work (eg. 'c' for the Create Ticket window or '?' for help).
# Do an action that creates a modal popup dialog, eg:
#* Click on the "Create" in the Jira header, then click Cancel. (Reproducible only in JIRA 7.2.0)
#* click on the thumbnail of the attached image. Once the image is displayed, click on the X in the top right corner to dismiss it. (Reproducible in both JIRA 7.2.0 and JIRA 6.3.15)
# Type a keyboard shortcut, eg. 'c' or '?'. The keyboard shortcut will work and the window will pop up.

h3. Expected Results
The Keyboard shortcuts do not work as the Keyboard Shortcut is disabled in the User profile.  

h3. Actual Results
The Keyboard shortcuts do work. 
 
h3. Notes
* Hard Refresh would make the shortcuts not work again
* Most keyboard shortcuts are relatively harmless because they prompt before doing anything. However, some just go off and do stuff without prompting, eg. 'i' for Assign to Me. This makes them dangerous.
fields.summary: Even if "Disable Keyboard shortcuts" is set, certain actions can trigger then back

h3. Problem Definition

Users may wish to include Timezone functionality into their Date/Time picker custom fields. By default, this isn't possible, so the user may proceed to configure the following formats in JIRA's *Administration >> System >> Advanced Settings*:
 * jira.date.time.picker.java.format
 ** Add 'z' to the format
 * jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format
 ** Add '%Z' to the format

!Timezone_Format.png|width=194,height=35,thumbnail!

This does allow the timezone to be shown in issue view and in the issue navigator for example. However, when the changes above are done and the Calendar selector is used to specify the custom field's value, the calendar cannot add the timezone on it's own and the user must manually type in the timezone.

!Calendar_No_Timezone.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Change/Extend the calendar selector to be able to accommodate timezone selection.
h3. Workaround

Manually type in the timezone for every entry; or, do not add timezones to the formats above.
fields.summary: Add timezone compatibility to the Date/Time Picker calendar selector

It is not mentioned anywhere in the REST API documentation that, when using Oauth to authenticate REST calls, the Oauth data has to be in the request header and not in the body.

This needs to be documented because putting the Oauth data in the request body works for some endpoints but not with all of them and this is causing confusion.

Below example page is not mentioning anything similar:
 - [JIRA REST API Example OAuth authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+REST+API+Example+-+OAuth+authentication]
fields.summary: It should be documented that, when using Oauth to authenticate REST calls, the Oauth data has to be put in the request header, not in the body

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is not possible to create a Hidden/Invisible user whereby this user able to access project in JIRA without other normal user notice them.

h3. Summary 

When the Labels system field has been hidden in the view issue screen but is still in the field configuration for the project it is still displayed in the view issue page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce.

2. Create a project.

5. Go to the view issue page.

BUG - The Labels field appears on the view issue screen and you can edit it via the pencil icon.

h3. Expected Results

The view issue page should not display fields that have been configured not to appear view screen configuration.

h3. Workaround

None.

None

h3. Summary:
When trying to follow the wizard to authenticate to another integrated application link with the *Display URL* and *Application URL* configured differently, it will throw the user a 500 page error at the end. The token is actually created in other side and refreshing JIRA Dashboard will show the Activity Stream.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Integrate JIRA with another Atlassian Product using the article below:
#- [How to create an unproxied application link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-create-an-unproxied-application-link-719095740.html]
# After it set, navigate to JIRA System Dashboard.
# The prompt to Authenticate to the integrated instance will come out in the Activity Stream.
# Click "Authenticate" and follow the wizard.

h3. Expected Result:
* The Wizard will finish and the user is redirected back to the Dashboard.

h3. Actual Result:
* The Wizard will end with a 500 page error.

h3. Notes:
* The token is actually created and JIRA will be able to retrieve information from another instance.
* Testing with Confluence, linking a Confluence page where it will ask for authentication as well, would not encountered the same issue.
fields.summary: 500 page error when authenticate from the Activity Stream.

h3. Summary
 # User Directory Incremental Synchronization does not run correctly on the 2nd Node when incremental synchronization enabled for 1 minute interval
 # It runs correctly on the 1st Node every minute

h3. Environment
 # JIRA Data Centre with at least 2 nodes ( Node 1 & Node 2 )
 # Crowd

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup JIRA Data Centre with 2 nodes ( Node 1 & Node 2 )
 # Add Crowd directory to Node 1 ( with incremental sync enabled for 1 minute interval ) and wait for it to appear on Node 2
 # Wait for the incremental sync to occur on both nodes

h3. Actual Results
 # Node 1 is working as expected
 # Incremental sync for Node 2 will be delayed or not updated
 # Incremental sync for Node 2 stops working after a while

h3. Expected Results

Incremental sync should run as expected on both nodes.
h3. Notes

User data will be up to date and not affected.

h3. Workaround

Set the synchronization to a one hour interval instead of every minute.
fields.summary: Incremental User Synchronization broken on data center

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
# It is currently not possible to allow issue types of a certain type to be resolved if there is a review
# We have  multiple issue types, some of which will never need a crucible review and others that we need to ensure do have a review.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Introduce a validator/condition on a workflow transition  to check if there is a review for issues of a selected type.
# For example in one project we have 'Story' and 'Bug' issue types and would expect that there is a review for any 'Story' however as a 'Bug' is an investigation that wouldn't require any code changes we would not need a review on these.
# For a 'Story' to then be put into a completed status it must have a review in Crucible (possibly also validating that is is a closed review).
fields.summary: Workflow validation for issue types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62309].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a user with username *user1* and email _user1@email.com_ in LDAP
# Connect JIRA to LDAP
# Users will be given the _jira-users_ group membership upon first log in which grants them access to JIRA (without it the user can't access JIRA)
# Issue collector is created with _Match reporter_ set to *Attempt to match user session of submitter or submitter email address*
# Do *not* log in to JIRA with this user yet to ensure that the user doesn't have access to JIRA
# Create an issue via the issue collector, entering _user1@email.com_ in the email field

h3. Actual Results
# The issue will fail to be created with the following error message
{quote}*Oops! Something went wrong...*
Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a JIRA application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application.
Don't worry though! We've logged this problem and will look into it soon!{quote}

This is expected because 
# The issue collector will find a user associated to the email address
# It finds the user *user1* and attempts to create the issue using this user
# It finds that the user doesn't have access to JIRA (since the user has not logged in before)
# Issue creation will fail

h3. Suggestion
Allow the Issue Collector to act as a Log In so this user is given the _jira-users_ group membership and the issue is successfully created
fields.summary: Allow Issue Collector to act as "log in" and grant the permissions to access JIRA to successfully create issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62308].
  {panel}

h2. *Issue Summary*

When a user imports an issue into JIRA 7.1.X, he or she is named as the issue creator while the reporter of the issue originally is marked as the reporter.

The above causes a lot of confusion when the user looks at the issues history and sees the importer mentioned as the creator while marking he created the issue a long time ago rather than the day the issue was imported.
h2. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a new JSON or CSV file that matches requirements JIRA expects.

{code:java}
IssueType, Summary, FixVersion, FixVersion, FixVersion, Component, Component, Issue ID, Parent ID, Reporter
Bug, "First issue", v1, , , Component1, , 1, , jbloggs
Bug, "Second issue", v2, , , Component1, Component2, 2, , fferdinando
Bug, "Third issue", v1, v2, v3, Component1, , 3, , fferdinando
Sub-task, "Fourth issue", v1, v2, , Component2, , , 2, jbloggs
{code}

 # Import the file to the target JIRA instance via external system import.
 # On completion, access the issue imported via the Issue Navigator page.
 # Go to history tab.

h2. *Expected Result*

JIRA does not show the importer as the issue creator especially not specifying the create date as actual date issue was created if it was specified in the CSV.
h2. *Actual Result*

JIRA shows the importer as the issue creator and specifies the created date as the date issue was originally created if it was specified in the CSV.
fields.summary: JIRA shows Issue Importer as Creator

h3. Summary

Can't set "Start date" and "Release date" in a version when using Japanese.
I couldn't reproduce this problem with any other language even if the language contains multi-byte characters (like Korean, French).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your language to Japanese in User Profile
# Go to *プロジェクト管理 > バージョン* page (*Project setting > Versions* page)
# Put a version name and click a calendar button
# Select a date in a dialog
 !calendar.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
We can set "Start date" and "Release date" correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The following error was shown.
 !date_format_error.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* As I mentioned above, this problem doesn't occur with other languages than Japanese
* Even if I set the date manually (put the date in "d/MMM/yy" format), the error persists
* I could also reproduce this problem on *Board > Release* page
* It seems to be similar to JRA-61665 but different problem

h3.Workaround
Change user's language to English and set the dates and turn the language back to the original one.
fields.summary: Can't set "Start date" and "Release date" in a version when using Japanese

h3. Problem Definition

When the transition fails, the input value for issue linked field will get cleared. But fields such as Comment, Label and etc., the values are stored on the screen. For more information on this behaviour, please review this video recording: {{[http://screencast.com/t/O3Lnx0yYM]}}.
 In the video, the *Due Date* is made to be required so that the transition will fail. As we can see from the video after the transition failed, the Linked Issue field got cleared but Cascading Field values and Comment Field value did not.
h3. Suggested Solution

Maintain the linked issues value even the transition fails.
fields.summary: Maintain the linked issues values when the workflow transition fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62300].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently, it is not possible for a user to keep a field from being visible until a certain part of the workflow if that field has a default value. Some users might want a field to appear later in the workflow of an issue but might want it to have a default value when appearing on a custom screen for users. For that field to be visible however, it has to be included in the 'View Issue' operation. Since the field will already have a value set, it will always be present, even if the field does not yet apply.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a default value for a field
# Create a custom screen for a workflow operation in the life of a ticket, and add this field to that screen
# Add the field to the view issue screen
# That field will appear from the creation of the ticket and will stay as long as a value is in place. This might not suite a user's needs if the user wants the field to apply to the custom screen in the workflow but not be present until then.

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
The field is set to the default value but only appears once applicable (using a custom screen for a workflow operation).

h3. Notes
The field will always be present.

h3.Workaround
Using a post function to SET the value after a workflow operation would work, but in the above scenario, a user would want the default value to be present in the screen so the field could be modified or changed before completing the operation.
fields.summary: Field Default Value causes value to always be present.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In short when user attempt to add the confluence URL to the Manage Gadgets > Subscription page , they run into this error :
{code:java}
Caused by: javax.net.ssl.SSLException: hostname in certificate didn't match: <localhost> != <atlassian>

{code}
Gadgets feature is not aware about the apache http server’s certificate that actually should be verified in the first place.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 6.4.5
 * Confluence 5.8.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate keystore as per the following command:
{code:java}
keytool -genkey -alias jira -keyalg RSA -keystore <JIRA_HOME>/tomcat.jks -dname "CN=Atlassian, OU=Unknown, O=Unknown, L=Unknown, ST=Unknown, C=Unknown" -ext SAN=ip:x.x.x.x

{code}

 # Configure JIRA and Confluence over SSL (self-signed certificate) using the keystore above.
 # Create an applinks.
 # Add *Confluence Base URL* via {{JIRA dashboard > Add Gadget > Manage Gadgets > Subscription}}
 # Hit into other errors below because JIRA and Confluence server IP is not matching the certificate SNI address:
{code:java}
Caused by: javax.net.ssl.SSLException: hostname in certificate didn't match: <localhost> != <atlassian>

{code}

h3. Expected Results

The expected results should be that the gadgets should communicate with the server when SAN (in certificate identified by browser, not only the java certificate of tomcat) is not configured for local machine domain name.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file when subscribing Confluence gadgets in JIRA page:
{noformat}
Caused by: javax.net.ssl.SSLException: hostname in certificate didn't match: <localhost> != <atlassian>

{noformat}
h3. Notes
 * The problem only affected gadgets requests from Confluence.
 * It doesn't occurs on other applinks feature such as JIRA macro page or issue links.

h3. Workaround
 * Find the related IP address that match to hostname and comment it via {{/etc/hosts}} file. Then, confluence Base URL will be successful suscribed.
 * Or put the DNS or hostname in the SAN when creating a keystore:
{code:java}
keytool -genkey -alias jira -keyalg RSA -keystore <JIRA_HOME>/tomcat.jks -dname "CN=Atlassian, OU=Unknown, O=Unknown, L=Unknown, ST=Unknown, C=Unknown" -ext SAN=ip:x.x.x.x,dns:localhost

{code}
fields.summary: Confluence gadgets will not be added in JIRA if hostname or DNS wasn't configured in the CN certificate

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After upgrading to JIRA 7, users are unable to set comment restriction to specific Project Role aside from Administrator.

h3. Environment

JIRA 7.1.9, JIRA 7.0.0

h3. Expected Results

User able to set comment restriction to any Project Role specified in Project Role of the Project where the issue belongs to.

h3. Actual Results

User only able to add restriction to Administrator project role.

h3.Workaround

Workaround 1:

Enable Groups & Project Roles in Comment visibility from JIRA's General Configuration. Now user can configure specific groups and restrict the comment to the specific group.

Workaround 2:

Add a JIRA-Administrator to the each of the other Project Roles. Refresh the comment page and the additonal Project Role will appear in comment page.
fields.summary: Project Role Comment Restriction

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Due to the removal of certain plugins within JIRA Cloud, such as the JIRA Suite Utilities, certain parts of the code have been moved into JIRA Cloud. However, some of the code changes have not made it into JIRA Server, so when migrating from Cloud to Server the workflows will be broken as they reference classes that do not exist.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a workflow with JSU 'Value Field' condition.
 # Export the instance to Server.
 # Install JSU plugin.
 # Try to use the workflow.

h3. Expected Results

The workflow proceeds as normal.
h3. Actual Results

The workflow fails to transition with the below error:
{noformat}
[c.a.jira.workflow.DefaultOSWorkflowConfigurator] Could not load class 'com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.ValueFieldCondition'

{noformat}
h3. Workaround

This can be worked around by renaming the new class names back to the old class names. For example renaming {{com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.ValueFieldCondition}} to {{com.googlecode.jsu.workflow.condition.ValueFieldCondition}} in the workflows will fix the problem.
h3. Notes

Reviewing the XML backups before and after the change shows the problem is obvious - the class name has changed:
{code:java|title=After}
			<validator name="" type="class">
              <arg name="contextHandling"></arg>
              <arg name="hidFieldsList">customfield_13600</arg>
              <arg name="errorMessage"></arg>
              <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.ValueFieldCondition</arg>
            </validator>
            <validator name="" type="class">
              <arg name="contextHandling"></arg>
              <arg name="hidFieldsList">customfield_12719</arg>
              <arg name="errorMessage">.</arg>
              <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.ValueFieldCondition</arg>
            </validator>

{code}
{code:java|title=Before}
			<validator name="" type="class">
			
              <arg name="fieldKey">customfield_13600</arg>
              <arg name="errorMessage"></arg>
              <arg name="class.name">com.googlecode.jsu.workflow.condition.ValueFieldCondition</arg>
            </validator>
            <validator name="" type="class">
			
              <arg name="fieldKey">customfield_12719</arg>
              <arg name="errorMessage"></arg>
              <arg name="class.name">com.googlecode.jsu.workflow.condition.ValueFieldCondition</arg>
            </validator>

{code}
fields.summary: Export from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server fails due to JIRA Suite Utilities changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Top navigation bar in JIRA is disappeared when upgraded from JIRA

Following stack trace can be seen from the log:

{code:java}
2016-03-02 09:32:08,412 http-bio-8641-exec-10 DEBUG admin 572x2667x1 1eld3da 172.20.44.74 /secure/admin/ViewLogging.jspa [com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess] Unable to run plugin code because of 'java.lang.RuntimeException - java.lang.NullPointerException'.
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.navigation.HeaderFooterRendering$8.visit(HeaderFooterRendering.java:357)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.navigation.HeaderFooterRendering$8.visit(HeaderFooterRendering.java:342)
	at com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess.invokeModule(SafePluginPointAccess.java:452)
	at com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess.descriptors(SafePluginPointAccess.java:150)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.navigation.HeaderFooterRendering.includeTopNavigation(HeaderFooterRendering.java:341)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.navigation.HeaderFooterRendering$1.run(HeaderFooterRendering.java:117)
	at com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess.runnable(SafePluginPointAccess.java:201)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.navigation.HeaderFooterRendering.includeTopNavigation(HeaderFooterRendering.java:112)

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.avatar.plugin.JiraUserAvatarProvider.isUsingExternalAvatar(JiraUserAvatarProvider.java:208)
	at com.atlassian.jira.avatar.plugin.JiraUserAvatarProvider$JiraUserPluginAvatar.<init>(JiraUserAvatarProvider.java:442)
	at com.atlassian.jira.avatar.plugin.JiraUserAvatarProvider.getAvatar(JiraUserAvatarProvider.java:176)
	at com.atlassian.jira.avatar.pluggable.AvatarProviderAdapter.getAvatar(AvatarProviderAdapter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.jira.avatar.AvatarServiceImpl.getAvatarURLImpl(AvatarServiceImpl.java:204)
	at com.atlassian.jira.avatar.AvatarServiceImpl.getAvatarURL(AvatarServiceImpl.java:217)
{code}

This problem happens because there's NULL error when retrieving the default avatar ID.

h3. Environment

So far it's only replicable with JIRA 6.4

h3. Expected Results

After upgrade the top bar is displayed correctly.

h3. Actual Results

Top bar is hidden.

h3.Workaround

(i) [Backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/backing-up-data-802592964.html] your JIRA.
1. Stop your JIRA.
2. Run the following query to retrieve id of default avatar:

{code:java}
select id from propertyentry where property_key like '%avatar.user.default%';
{code}

3. Update the propertrystring entry using the following query:

{code:java}
insert into propertystring values (result-of-query-above, 10122);
{code}

4. Restart your JIRA.
fields.summary: Top bar hidden after upgrading JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The OAuth configuration form on the application link settings is not shown if the user has not logged on Confluence before.
h3. Environment

Confluence: 5.8.18, 5.10.0, 5.10.2
 Chrome: 52.0.2743.116
 Firefox: 47.0.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA and Confluence.
 # Make sure *websudo* is enabled in both JIRA and Confluence.
 # In JIRA, create a new application link to Confluence.
 # Open an incognito/private session and log into JIRA again.
 # Edit the application link to Confluence.
 # Try to access the *OAuth* tab in the Outgoing and Incoming authentication.

h3. Expected Results

The iframe containing the OAuth configuration form is displayed, or a dialog asking to authenticate is shown.
h3. Actual Results

The iframe is not shown and the message below appears on the browser's web console.
{code:java}
Load denied by X-Frame-Options: http://ecrmac-632.local:8090/login.action?os_destination=http%3A%2F%2Fecrmac-632.local%3A8090%2Fplugins%2Fservlet%2Fapplinks%2Fauth%2Fconf%2Foauth%2Fadd-consumer-by-url%2F0e8a2470-9179-3e5a-ba33-28c69a78f494%3Fuiposition%3Dremote%26hostUrl%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Fecrmac-632.local%253A9090%252FPS-6546%26outgoing2LOEnabled%3Dtrue%26outgoing2LOiEnabled%3Dtrue%26oauth-outgoing-enabled%3Dtrue&permissionViolation=true does not permit cross-origin framing.
{code}
!Screen Shot 2016-08-17 at 6.56.04 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Log into Confluence and access the application link configuration page before attempting to edit the application link configuration.

h3. Notes
JIRA 7.2.0+ is not affected by this bug.
fields.summary: OAuth configuration form on the application link settings is not shown if the user have not logged on Confluence before

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62267].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA to allow OAuth for REST calls for specific application A, you need to create  _Application Link_ for this (see [oauth-authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-apis/jira-rest-apis/jira-rest-api-tutorials/jira-rest-api-example-oauth-authentication]). Problem is that application A might not have any UI and it's purely consumer. In this case _Application Link_ page always alerts that Generic Link is down and _Outgoing Authentication_ doesn't make sense.

h3. Suggested Solution
Created specific OAuth configuration for incoming only Application Links.
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want to configure simple OAuth for rest calls
Show status or workflow in the comments section

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62265].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Can't use multi-byte characters to search issues when linking issues.

h3. Environment
* IE11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue whose summary include multi-byte characters like "テスト"
# Link the issue from another issue
# Click "search for an issue" in the issue linking dialog
 !link.png|thumbnail! 
# Use multi-byte characters in "Find JIRA issues" dialog to search the issue which you created in the step 1

h3. Expected Results
The issue should be hit by the search correctly as it is in other browsers (Firefox, Chrome).
 !chrome.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The following errors was shown.
 !ie11.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* As I mentioned above, this problem didn't happen in Firefox, Chrome
* I confirmed that this problem happened with Japanese, Chinese, Korean and Russian characters

h3.Workaround
* Use other browsers
* Search issues without using "search for an issue"
fields.summary: Can't use multi-byte characters to search issues when linking issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

I had to deal with the pop up reminder persistently showing up for an entire month warning me about changes to a plugin -- EVERYTIME I opened a new jira task- I can have more than a dozen windows open requiring me to dismiss the pop up each and every time (it gets in the way). Now I have this pop up reminder for HipChat which I don't even use annoying the living shit out of me!

"HipChat Integration is out of date
Update to take full advantage of the latest features.
Update Now!"

Seriously, you cannot continue to abuse this overlay. I understand how it's a useful tool for communicating critical updates...ONCE or a few times, but NOT marketing and NOT forcing it down our throats every single time - this is literally driving me NUTS. 

Otherwise, I love JIRA :)
fields.summary: Please for the love of god stop with the persistent pop ups!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62262].
  {panel}

In order to make Logging Work easier and more accurate, I would like to suggest that when a user enters a value into the *Time Spent* field of the *Log Work* modal, that the *Date Started* field would automatically decrease by the amount of *Time Spent*.

This seems like a good default behavior to me because, my usual use case is:
 # I click on *Fix in Progress* and I write down what time I started working on the JIRA ticket on my notepad.
 # Then, when I am done working on the ticket or I switch to another task, I write down in my notepad what time I stopped working on the ticket.
 # I go back to *JIRA* and I click on *Log Work*.
 # In the *Log Work* modal I enter the *Time Spent* by figuring out how much time elapsed between the time I started working on the ticket and the time I stopped.
 # Then I always have to change the *Date Started* because it is always set to the current time and date by default, and there is NEVER a situation where that is the right value. If *Time Spent* was 15 minutes and the current date and time is _August 17, 2016 *4:00*PM_ then the actual *Date Started* has to be at least 15 minutes earlier than the current date and time, so _August 17, 2016 *3:45*PM_ would be a realistic value.
fields.summary: Adjust 'Date Started' Based Upon 'Time Spent' in the 'Log Work' Modal
Ability to specify different status to represent "RESOLVED"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62260].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer has received following warnings when creating the tables in a MS SQL DB with the correct collation.
{code}
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'idx_group_attr_dir_name_lval' has maximum length of 1029 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'uk_group_attr_name_lval' has maximum length of 1029 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'idx_mem_dir_parent_child' has maximum length of 1149 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'idx_user_attr_dir_name_lval' has maximum length of 1029 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'entpropindexdoc_module' has maximum length of 1020 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'licenserolegroup_index' has maximum length of 1020 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.
Warning! The maximum key length is 900 bytes. The index 'managedconfigitem_id_type_idx' has maximum length of 1020 bytes. For some combination of large values, the insert/update operation will fail.
{code}
The problem is that the nvarchar type will take two times the actual length of data entered + 2 bytes (see [MS KB|https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms186939.aspx]) which will take 255*2+2=512 bytes for each column and if the index contains more than one nvarchar column then warning message is thrown.

h2. Suggested Solution
In reality it's relatively rare to reach the limit in order for the index to fail. However it would be nice if we can limit the column length at first place.
fields.summary: Some indexes in JIRA have a maximum value bigger than 900 bytes which is not recommend in MS SQL Server.
